conclusion: Blocks A and B are dropped due to gravity.
A lands on the zig-zag patterned cloth (left).
B lands on the solid pink cloth (right).
Each block's weight makes its respective cloth sag until the cloth meets the taller rigid objects below it.
A causes the zig-zag cloth to drape over block C and stops when it contacts the table surface.
B causes the pink cloth to drape over blocks E and F; because F is the tallest, the cloth first touches the top of F and then hangs down around it.
Both cloths end up draped over the rigid blocks underneath, conforming to their shapes and settling with the lowest parts touching the tabletop.
